name: HTTP/3 protocol
description: Third version of the HTTP networking protocol which uses QUIC as transport protocol. Previously known as HTTP-over-QUIC, now standardized as HTTP/3.

byNum.1: Can be enabled in Firefox via the `network.http.http3.enabled` pref in `about:config`.
byNum.2: Can be enabled in Chrome(Chromium) via the `--enable-quic` & `--quic-version=h3-23` command line arguments.
byNum.3: Can be enabled in Chrome(Chromium) via the `--enable-quic` & `--quic-version=h3-29` command line arguments.
byNum.4: Requires macOS 11 Big Sur or later.
byNum.5: Since Sept 2024, HTTP3 is enabled for all users of Safari 16 and newer. Before then, it was enabled for a subset of users. Enabling the feature flag ensured support.
byNum.6: Based on real-world data from July 2025, the current versions of Samsung Internet do not support HTTP/3.
